item.description:
Home of American Impressionism - If you did not get your fill of Monet's Impressionism exhibit at Wadsworth come join us...

MUSIC AT THE MUSEUM

 Thanks in large measure to "Miss Florence" Griswold, what is known today as the Florence Griswold Museum has, for more than a century, been the home of the Lyme Art Colony, America's center of Impressionism. The collection at the museum is amazing, come explore the exhibits and then join us for music at 2PM. 

 

 Bonsai Concerts at the Museum  - Making the Most of Minimalism

Blending multi-layered prepared recordings with live violin and viola creates an audio kaleidoscope of mesmerizing sound. Ingenious and intriguing, this concert explores Minimalism from seminal music of the 1960s to 1990s by Kastelle and others.

 Gabriel Kastelle, Musician, Composer, and Musicologist
Concerts are included with Museum Admission. No reservations required.  Join violinist and Bonsai Concert creator Gabriel Kastelle for this compelling series of intimate mini-concerts. Originally presented in his New London studio, Kastelle has chosen three popular events for “reframing” in the Museum’s galleries.

Admission:

$9 Adults
$8 Seniors

 

Blending multi-layered prepared recordings with live violin and viola creates an audio kaleidoscope of mesmerizing sound. Ingenious and intriguing, this concert explores Minimalism from seminal music of the 1960s to 1990s by Kastelle and others.
item.how_to_find_us: meet in the entrance, will wear the bw scarf with piano keys
item.why: Its the Home Of American Impressionism
item.name: MUSIC AT THE MUSEUM - Florence Griswold
